repositoryProvider.description: either null or github or gitlab, etc.
either null or github or gitlab, etc.

parentId.description: if created as a child project

externalEntityId.description: only set if this is an external entity
only set if this is an external entity

x-enum-comments.VulnStateFalsePositive: we can use that for crowdsource vulnerability management. 27 People marked this as false positive and they have the same dependency tree - propably you are not either
x-enum-comments.VulnStateFixed: we did not find the dependencyVuln anymore in the last scan!

version.description: either version or semver is defined

versionFixed.description: for non semver packages - if both are defined, THIS one should be used for displaying. We might fake semver versions just for database querying and ordering

versionIntroduced.description: for non semver packages - if both are defined, THIS one should be used for displaying. We might fake semver versions just for database querying and ordering

day.description: on the day 2024-08-12 the asset had a sumRisk of 25.

repositoryId.description: the id will be prefixed with the provider name, e.g. github:<github app installation id>:123456

vulnAutoReopenAfterDays.description: Auto-reopen configuration - number of days after which closed/accepted vulnerabilities should be reopened

artifact.description: Ensure foreign key field order matches Artifact primary key: ArtifactName, AssetVersionName, AssetID

assetVersionName.description: Foreign key fields for AssetVersion relationship

component.description:
the provided sbom from cyclondx only contains the transitive dependencies, which do really get used
this means, that the dependency graph between people using the same library might differ, since they use it differently
we use edges, which provide the information, that a component is used by another component in one asset

componentPurl.description: will be nil, for direct dependencies

email.description: Email is the email address of the user the invitation is for

organizationId.description: OrganizationID is the ID of the organization the invitation is for

scopes.description: whitespace separated scopes manage-project read-project scan-asset manage-all

opaqueId.description: only used by global policies maintained by the community and migrated by the system

organizationId.description: will be null for global policies

repositoryId.description: the id will be prefixed with the provider name, e.g. github:<github app installation id>:123456
